cleaned_text: I was working on a piece about [how to respond to anti-vaccination beliefs](http://inside.org.au/injecting-a-dose-of-science/), when it struck me that, in the absence of the germ theory of disease, vaccination looks a lot like homeopathy - you use a tiny amount of something that causes a mild version of the disease you want to prevent. I wondered whether the success of vaccination in the 18th century had any impact on the development of homeopathy. A very casual search suggests not, though there is something called [homeopathic vaccination](http://www.sunshinecoastdaily.com.au/news/parents-not-protecting-kids-homeopathtic-vaccinate/1969839/).
